Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2008 07:28AM - edited Oct 16, 2008 07:40AM by jerseymaria caroline, when i did that recently i did pick up all my path slides but it was from my local hospital so i was able to do it.  i hand carried them to fox chase cancer center in phila because ups had already lost my large packet of reports and paperwork.  my original plan was to have fox chase send them back to my hospital and they would then send to sloan kettering.  i did decide not to do that because i didn't t hink sloan would get different results than fox chase.  so fox chase sent slides back to my local hospital.  who also said they do this all the time.  i would hope that any of the major cancer centers would give totally reliable pathology results.  the reports were sent to my current onc.  she was the one who suggested that i get these other consultations. i don't see why you couldn't have the results sent to whoever you wanted them sent to. johns  hopkins has a wonderful reputation so i would be totally confident in their results.  good luck.  maria

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2008 08:21AM jerseymaria wrote: janis, i too am so glad to see this post.  i feel exactly the same way but did not the the courage to post my feelings.  ever since my mets dx i've really changed.  i'm pesimistic, angry, sad, i cry all the time and i'm just frickin scared.  why does treatment work (especially the "miracle" drug herceptin) for some...what about me.  don't get me wrong i'm sincerely happy for those who get clean scans and are ned.  i'm so tired to putting on the good face.  i'm especially tired of those who say no one knows when they're going to die.  no s...t.  or how...yeah well i'm pretty sure of how i'm going to die and it's not a pleasant way. i'm tired of hearing how brave i am.  i AM NOT BRAVE.  last week i actually pulled out an outfit to be used for my burial and brought to cleaners so it would be ready when the time comes.  how sick is that.  i realize that many many ladies here are in much worse situations than i am, but i've never once had a good scan.  every one shows progress.  the past few days have been especially hard because today i'm starting xeloda and tomorrow tykerb and i'm terrified.  i've never been off treatment in 2 1/2 years and probably never will.  i'm sick of being sick.  i guess i'm in a long term pity party but it's hard not to be.  i too have thought - is this my last birthday, last christmas.  this is no way to live.  i do still pray but more for others than myself.  i know it's wrong but i feel like praying for myself is a waste of time.  i hope you're having a better day...you certainly deserve it.  and thanks again for bring this subject up.  this site is better than having a psychiatrist.  hugs, maria

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2008 01:04PM jerseymaria wrote: first of all may i say that the wrist cuffs are  not known to be accurate.  2nd of all bp should never be taken in the same arm unless at least 10 minutes have lapsed from when it was first taken.  it will result in an incorrect reading.  the tubing should be directly over the artery.  never cross your legs and try to breathe slowly and relax. the reading will vary between sitting and supine position.  the wrong size cuff will also result in a false reading, as will an old worn cuff. the cuff should be inflated to 200mmHg unless the patient is known to have very high bp.  the pressure should be released slowly enough that the systolic sounds are clearly heard at start and the when no longer heard that is the diastolic reading.  finally the hearing of the taker can vary.  i remember many times when a doc would say he couldn't get the pressure and i would hear it very clearly.  if it's clearly painful that is usually because the cuff size in wrong or it's being inflated way too much (unless of course someone is unusually sensitive (like with fibro for ex.) i remember once the idiot taking my pressure had the tubing in the back by my elbow.  so i calmly told here there was no artery back there.

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2008 07:53AM jerseymaria wrote: greta, i got ss disability when i was 55 due to lupus. i've heard that the closer you are in age to retirement age the easier it is to get.  both my husband and i were both told that our disability payment would be the same as what we would get if we worked to 65.  my husband just turned 65 and his payment is exactly the same it's just called ss now instead of disability.  i've never heard of disability paying more money than regular ss unless ssi comes into and that is based i think on low income.  never hurts to go and talk to them.  both times i did they were super nice and helpful.  i've read on here somewhere that if you have mets then it's an automatic.  be prepared, lots and lots of paperwork but they declared me disabled 2 years before i applied.  i even got 18 months retroactive payments so it was quite a lump sum.  18 months is as far as they could go back for payments they told me.  i found all this out on my birthday that year so it was quite a birthday present.  good luck.
Posts.Title: Disability greta kgrimm

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2008 09:24AM jerseymaria wrote: kgrimm, the reason that you would get less if you retired at 62 than your disability is that when you get ss disability they pay you what you would have received IF you had worked to 65.  the increase at the beginning of the year is a yearly thing and is based somehow on the rate of inflation.  inflation has been low past few years so the increases have been small.  my husband's increases are always more than mine cause his ss is higher than mine.  but of course it gets offset by the increase in medicare part B.  i'm just thankful we get it in addition to hubs pension.  we are very lucky also because one of his retirement benefits is that we get reimbursed for what is taken out for medicare part B.  take care, maria
Posts.Title: Disability greta kgrimm

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2008 10:41AM - edited Sep 6, 2008 10:42AM by jerseymaria donna, if you retire at age 62 (not disability) you're not eligible for medicare until you reach 65.  if you get ss disability it's 2 years for medicare unless they backdate your disability date.  they did that with me.  that's why i got retroactive payment. my first payment was in aug. and i went on medicare the next feb. hope i'm making sense?

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 04:48PM jerseymaria wrote: hi locks08...i hope i can help.  i don't know very much about the markers but i'll tell you what i've had.  my first onc (the incompetent jerk) only did the ca-27-29 which is a blood marker for breast cancer only.  normal is i think anything under 30 or 34...i don't remember exactly.  the onc i see now does that marker plus the cea which is a more general marker and shows cancer cell activity for breast, lung, liver and colon cancer.  i believe the range is up to 4.0   supposedly if the markers are elevated that means there are circulating cancer cells in the blood which is not a good thing.  my docs reasoning is that since my ca27-29 is still normal that there are no breast cancer cells circulating but is concerned about colon cancer cells.    in the scheme of things my number is still pretty low but being that they have been normal all along and now are elevated even a little bit we have to check.  i guess she's just being very diligent but i know many onc. don't even do markers.  so i sure hope i don't go thru hell for nothing but i have to do what she tells me to do.   hope this helps - some others probably know more about markers than i do.

Posts.Content: jerseymaria wrote: hi, i don't post often but i do read all your posts daily. i had my last herceptin in jan and in 2 weeks i'm scheduled for my first pet scan. i'm stage IIIB, her2+++.  when i was diagnosed i was told in so many words that it wasn't a case of if my cancer would come back but when.  i was diagnosed in Feb. 06, had L mastectomy in March, port in April 06.  4 AC, 4 Taxotere, radiation and 1 year of herceptin. throughout all of this my tumor markers were totally normal...not even 1 rise.  in nov. my ca27-29 remained normal but my cea rose to 20.8.  onc. repeated and it was 18.6.  So normally i would be totally freaked out over the pet scan since i know they're basically looking for mets.  (i forgot to mention i had 9+nodes out of 27)  But what is making is worse is that my onc keeps throwing out colon cancer because only the cea showed a rise.  i know that many of you don't feel tumor markers are accurate but her point is that since they were always normal and now have showed an increase and that since the ca27-29 remained normal that this is not a result of breast cancer recurrance. so that's it.  i know that most of you have gone thru so much more than i have so please don't think i'm whining, it's just that i've barely finished treatment after 2 years and i'm just so so scared. i guess i'm just looking for reassurance. thanks for listening...i had to get this off my chest...i really haven't told anyone about the markers. maria Dx 2/27/2006, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 9/25 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 01:11AM jerseymaria wrote: hi bonnie. i was going to post my news from today when i ready your post. i am stage IIIB, 9 positive nodes, hormone receptor negative, her2+++. today had my next to last herceptin infusion which i have tolerated very well.  did have left mastectomy, ac x4, taxotere x4, radiation for 6 weeks before starting herceptin.  from the very beginning in spite of the agressiveness of my cancer my panels have been super normal. last month my ca27-29 remained good at 16 but my cea which has always been in the 2. range was 20.8.  doc was concerned but said was not anything to do with a breast recurrance but mentioned the lung and colon cancer.  so we repeated it.  i prayed it was a fluke but today got results.  it was 18.7.  so it did go down a bit but clearly still elevated.  she mentioned colon cancer again.  i am so scared.  not even done with treatment and might have another kind of cancer?  she said after my last herceptin we'll do a pet scan and colonoscopy.  i'm trying to be strong but not doing so well.  she did say though that sometimes inflammation can cause an increase but the point is that since the beginning it's been normal and now has increased. any comments or encouragement greatly needed. maria

Posts.Content: jerseymaria wrote: 1st thank you all for your prayers and good wishes.  watson, you made me laugh.  my pockets weren't big enough but i sure did feel the support coming thru.  ok here it goes.  there was progression...we knew that.  last scan said extensive, this one just said progression. mostly in abdomen.  the few pelvic nodes are still there but stable.  the abdomen has many more positive nodes and the ones there before have increased in size some substantially.  report said there is 1 thoracic node in prevascular space (huh?) that has increased in size.  there are a few nodes in chest area with no metabolic uptake but have increased in size.  the report detailed the many nodes and sizes and previous sizes.  one thing i think is new that i don't know about...says....within the right retropharyngeal space there may be a nodule but area is obscured by dental amalgam.  where the heck is that?  did i say some nodes in chest area with no uptake?  so progression is not good however on the positive side, nothing showed in any organs.  i'm thinking that the lymph system is doing exactly what it is supposed to do and that is to trap bad things. i hope i'm not being naive. so i'll be going on tykerb and xeloda.  i've already ordered udderly smooth from drugstore.com.  spoke to pharmacy and they said only doc or institutions can order the tykerb but they will have the xeloda tomorrow.  and the best news of all is that my rx plan approved it at my normal low co-pay.  i am so thankful for that.  actually they approved the tykerb also it's just that the pharmacy can't order it for me. so hopefully these drugs will do what herceptin didn't do and se's won't be too bad.  sorry for writing a book and thanks so much again for your prayers.  love, maria Dx 2/27/2006, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 9/25 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
